Description: Deoxidised blackware pottery bowl, very finely handmade. Squat rounded body witha carinated shoulder and short neck with everted rim. There are impressed lines on the rim and an incised line 1.5cm below the rim. The surface is lightly burnished and two impressed motifs made with a wedge-stamp are on opposite sides of the shoulder, one on a sherd that has broken off. In between these motifs is an incised offering table.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (Figure 31.) (Type C73, H11)
